page.title: 06Farming around Mousehole
page.content: The{farms}around{Mousehole}vary in size from about 50 to 150 acres or slightly more, with only a very few small holdings. The main produce from these{farms}is milk which is processed at the St. Ivel Creamary aty St. Erth. In order to feed the cattle during the winter much of the land is intensively managed grassland which is cropped for{hay and silage}during the Spring and Summer. Some other crops which are grown in the area are{early Cornish potatoes, {spring cabbage, broccoli and flowers such as anmemones and violets. The {farmers}of this area have the advantage of very mild winters which enables them to produce earlier crops than most other areas of the mainland.
